data.fullContent: In 1838, Van Buren directed General Winfield Scott to forcibly institute the removal of all those Cherokee who had not complied with the 1835 Treaty of New Echota-by departing from the Southeastern United States and moving west (to present day Oklahoma). The Cherokee were herded violently into internment camps, where they were kept for the summer of 1838. The actual transportation west was delayed by intense heat and drought, but in the fall, the Cherokee reluctantly agreed to transport themselves west. During the Cherokee removal, part of the Trail of Tears, some 20,000 people were involuntarily relocated.
data.answer: 1838年，范布伦指示温菲尔德·斯科特将军通过撤离美国东南部并将其迁往美国（今天是俄克拉荷马州），将所有不遵守1835年《新回声条约》的切诺基人强行撤职。切诺基人被猛烈地放进了拘留营，并在这里被拘留了1838年夏天。由于酷热和干旱，西部的实际运输受到了延误，但在秋天，切诺基人勉强同意将自己运往西部。在切罗基族人的眼泪之路的拆除过程中，约有20,000人被非自愿迁移。
